Finding Description & Remediation: Detected user input used to manually construct a SQL string. This is usually bad practice because manual construction could accidentally result in a SQL injection. An attacker could use a SQL injection to steal or modify contents of the database. Instead, use a parameterized query which is available by default in most database engines. Alternatively, consider using an object-relational mapper (ORM) such as Sequelize which will protect your queries.

Detected a sequelize statement that is tainted by user-input. This could lead to SQL injection if the variable is user-controlled and is not properly sanitized. In order to prevent SQL injection, it is recommended to use parameterized queries or prepared statements.
When data from an untrusted source is put into a logger and not neutralized correctly, an attacker could forge log entries or include malicious content.

When data from an untrusted source is put into a logger and not neutralized correctly, an attacker could forge log entries or include malicious content. Please use the Jsoup.clean() function to sanitize data.
